policyNews.headline: Japan surpassed its foreign enrolment target of 400,000 in 2025
policyNews.description: Japan’s Immigration Services Agency has announced that the number of international students in the country as of June 2025 rose to 435,200, up +8.2% over 2024. The jump was driven by a record increase in first-time students (180,000). …

policyNews.headline: Canada’s foreign enrolment has fallen by nearly 300,000 students over the last two years
policyNews.description: Speaking in the East Coast city of Halifax last month, Canadian Immigration Minister Lena Metlege Diab said that the number of international students in Canada dropped from over a million at the beginning of 2024 to roughly 700,000 as of November 2025. …
